Verification of the photograph: The expert would have examined the photograph in question to determine its authenticity. This would involve analyzing the image for any signs of manipulation or editing.
Comparison with previous instances: The expert would have looked for any previous instances or publications of the same photograph to confirm its existence and context. This could involve conducting reverse image searches or checking archives.
Analysis of contextual details: The expert would have scrutinized the background of the photograph, such as the presence of flags or banners, to gather additional information and assess its relevance to the claim. This would help in understanding the context and potential biases associated with the image.
Corroboration with other sources: The expert would have cross-referenced the claim with other sources, such as news articles or social media posts, to see if there is any supporting evidence or contradictory information available. This would help in establishing the credibility of the claim.
